StringTable.String: The Corporate Sector is excellent at research and development and quick to maximize the economic potential of any new discovery. They have many ways to fill up the treasury, and they are well-served to use them: their citizens are happiest when they are wealthy, and dislike being poor.

StringTable.Label: BraveNewUniverse_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: In 2317, Subspace Streaming allowed for travel to parts of the Galaxy previously uncharted by the Civilizations of the Orion Sector. In these distant systems are Civilizations capable of faster-than-light travel and have developed advanced technologies. Among them is the Luxar Dominion, a group of crystalline beings with plans for a vast array of arms.[BR][BR]Tensions rise With so many new players on the galactic stage. Is the Luxar Dominion open to forming alliances, or will they utilize their horrifying Terror Stars to wipe out entire systems?[BR][BR]The situation is delicate; one misstep could lead to an all-out war.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_BraveNewUniverse_Overall_Dec
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance is at the center of a delicate situation. A misstep could lead to a war that leaves countless dead. All-out war should be avoided by any means necessary. Some conflict may be unavoidable, but it should not be sought out. Achieve an [HS=HS_AllianceVictory]Alliance Victory[/HS] by allying with all other major civilizations.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Campaign_BraveNewUniverse_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: Through the use of Subspace Streaming, contact has been made with new Civilizations. Among them is the Luxar Dominion, who developed hyperdrive technology independently, as the Terran Alliance did. They seem prominent and powerful.[BR][BR]The Terran Alliance is now in a delicate situation. The Alliance's actions here can shape the relationship between the disparate Civilizations. A misstep here may lead to a devastating war.[BR][BR]The Terran Alliance must use its sway to keep the peace and form healthy relationships.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Campaign_BraveNewUniverse_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance can use diplomacy and military might to influence the civilizations around them. Some conflict may be required, but it should be quelled and avoided whenever possible. Anything but an Influence Victory here threatens all life across the Galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Radioactive_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: 2317, the year the Orion sector contacts an entirely new part of the Galaxy. Among the Civilizations reached is the Cosmic Contaminant, a group of nearly incomprehensible lifeforms known as the Irradiated. The Luxar Dominion attempts to rally allies to help exterminate the Cosmic Contaminant.[BR][BR]The Cosmic Contaminant has not survived for millennia, where all other life decays, to be destroyed by those that can't adapt.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Radioactive_Overall_Dec
StringTable.String: It's time for the Cosmic Contaminant to do more than survive. The Luxar Dominion has all but ensured there will be no allies among the stars. As other civilizations prepare for war, so should the Cosmic Contaminant. Achieve a [HS=HS_ConquestVictory]Conquest Victory[/HS] by eliminating all other major civilizations.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ABSOLUTE_Radioactive_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Irradiated developed on toxic and radioactive worlds. Where all others wither, they thrive. They are a threatening enigma that has devastated all others they've encountered. Over time, they have only become more effective at turning planets into polluted wastelands.[BR][BR]The Luxar Dominion, all too familiar with the Irradiated, is attempting to rally the newly contacted Civilizations of the Orion sector against what has been termed the Cosmic Contaminant. They can not be allowed to succeed.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ABSOLUTE_Radioactive_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Assume the Cosmic Contaminant will find no allies here. Treat all other Civilizations as hostile. Utilize all the various ways to pollute planets and render them uninhabitable to all but the Irradiated. A war of attrition benefits the Contaminant, who thrive on planets poisoned in the conflict and replenish numbers quickly.

StringTable.Label: ReturnOfKorath_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: 2317, among the upheaval, the Korath Clan returns. The Korath Clan was legendary in the Drengin Empire as shock troops. They were often at the front of any attack and were renowned for their ferocity and viciousness. The Korath Clan believed that all life was inferior to the Drengin and unworthy of existence. They believed anything weak should be eradicated from the universe, deviating sharply from the Drengin Empire's tendency to enthrall groups they saw as lesser. The strife caused by these philosophical differences caused the Korath Clan to break from the Empire. The Korath Clan became even more noteworthy after their contact with the Dread Lords left them physically altered. The Korath Clan believes they are the true Drengin and seek to drive all others to extinction, even the Empire they once served.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_ReturnOfKorath_Overall_Dec
StringTable.String: The only group worthy of survival is the Korath Clan, and the Korath is more than prepared to prove it. The only course is destruction. Achieve a [HS=HS_ConquestVictory]Conquest Victory[/HS] by driving all other major civilizations to extinction in the name of the Korath Clan.
